se.hig.exte.restcontroller

Class FileController

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.hig.exte.restcontroller.FileController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.web.servlet.HandlerExceptionResolver

    @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/files")
public class FileController
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.web.servlet.HandlerExceptionResolver
    A RestController class responsible for mapping HTTP requests to the /files path. This class calls services that store and fetches file resources.

    • Constructor Summary

      FileController(FileService fileService, ExamService examService)
      Creates a FileController.

    • Method Detail

      • handleFileDownload

        @GetMapping(value="/download/{fileName}",
            produces="application/pdf")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<byte[]> handleFileDownload(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                              java.lang.String fileName)
        Gets a file stored on the server. This method is run when a HTTP GET request is made to the end-point /download/{fileName}. The specified file name must contain the file extension (e.g. ".pdf"). Returns an empty response and a status code of "404 - not found" if the file is not found.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file on the server to fetch.
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity containing a byte array containing the file.

      • handleFileUpload

        @PostMapping(value="/upload")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> handleFileUpload(@RequestParam(value="file")
                                                                                                                 org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file)
        Uploads a file to the server. This method is run when a HTTP POST request is made to the end-point files/upload/ and expects a MultipartFile. Returns a status code of "417 - expectation failed" if a file with the specified name already exists or if the file is not a PDF file.
        Parameters:
        file - The MultiPartFile to upload to the server.
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity containing a message and status code 200 if successful, else 417.
